bannerCon.title: National Service Scheme
bannerCon.bannerCon: Training minds, empowering skills, and launching successful careers

blocks.value: To build the youth with the mind and spirit to serve the society and work for the social uplift of the down-trodden masses of our nation as a movement.

The National Service Scheme has been functioning with the motto **NOT ME BUT YOU** in view of making the youth inspired in service of the people and hence NSS Aims Education through Community Service and Community Service through Education.
National Service Scheme of Karpagam Academy of Higher Education is functioning with Five Self Financing Units recognized by the Ministry of Youth Affairs & Sports, Government of India.

We have brought a lot of awareness through N.S.S. It brings to all of us a platform to serve society and brings happiness and smile on many faces. We created a hub to deliver service to society by showcasing our Knowledge. So, it’s not simply an association; a reason to achieve our objective and carry on the legacy for the coming years. NSS undertake various activities either independently or along with Government departments and NGOs. The following are the highlights of various activities.

items: An awareness programme for water conservation, energy conservation, usage of renewable energy such as solar energy and Government subsidy available.
The students cleaned the Government High Schools in adopted villages, white washed the class rooms, and planted trees.
NSS organized intramural sports competitions at Government Schools.
Students educated the rural people on the advantages of digital payments by providing them hands-on experience.
Training provided to rural households on computer functional literacy (Email, Skype, and Digital Transactions) to communicate with overseas family members.
Organized medical camps (General and Eye) along with government and private medical agencies to create awareness about communicable diseases.
Campaigns conducted in rural areas on Sanitation and Hygiene.
Education-related programmes and celebration of National and International Days.

blocks.value: Also, many social awareness programmes such as Tobacco-Free Village, Avoiding Open Defecation, Solid Waste Management, Plastic Eradication, Tree Plantation, Rural Women’s Day, International Women’s Day, Indian Constitution Day, Poshan Abhiyan, Jal Sakthi Abhiyan and Organic Farming etc., were organized in the villages. Awareness Programmes conducted on Environmental Pollution and Its Control Measures, Child Obesity Prevention, Breast Cancer, Organ Donation, Child abuse and Legal Literacy.

Students voluntarily donated blood to the needy people in the government and private hospitals whenever they need. Volunteers also render their helping hand spontaneously at the time of emergency created by natural calamities such as Kaja Cyclone by free supply of material and food items.
NSS Units of KAHE organize Seven Days Annual Special Camps regularly at adopted villages.
